title: Week 1: Introduction to Reinforcement Learning
description: Overview of RL, key concepts, and definitions. Develop foundational understanding.

title: Week 2: Dynamic Programming Principles
description: Focus on policy evaluation, policy improvement, and value functions. Understand dynamic programming methods.

title: Week 3: Monte Carlo Methods
description: Study Monte Carlo estimation and control. Analyze RL algorithms using Monte Carlo methods.

title: Week 4: Temporal-Difference Learning
description: Explore TD learning methods, including Q-learning. Evaluate the efficiency of TD methods.

title: Week 5: Function Approximation
description: Understand value function approximation and policy approximation techniques.

title: Week 6: Exploration vs. Exploitation
description: Discuss strategies for exploration within RL. Analyze exploration strategies.

title: Week 7: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
description: Introduction to multi-agent systems in RL. Explore RL’s interdisciplinary connections.

title: Week 8: Advanced Policy Gradient Methods
description: Examine policy gradients and actor-critic methods. Critically analyze gradient methods.

title: Week 9: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
description: Overview of model-based methods in RL. Apply RL techniques to optimization tasks.

title: Week 10: Applications to Control
description: Utilize RL in control systems design. Analyze real-world applications through case studies.

title: Week 11: Neural Networks and RL
description: Investigate the role of deep learning in RL and its integration with neural networks.

title: Week 12: Ethics in AI and RL
description: Assess ethical implications of RL applications through case studies and discussions.

title: Week 13: Research Methodologies in RL
description: Learn about designing experiments and conducting literature reviews to enhance research skills.

title: Week 14: Project Development and Work Time
description: In-class project development with group discussions and presentations. Prepare for final presentations.

title: Week 15: Student Research Presentations
description: Presentation of independent research projects, focusing on effective communication of findings.
